Package kdl.prox.qged

Class Summary
AnnotationFormat Format that knows how to parse and print Annotation objects.
BooleanFormat Format that knows how to parse and print Boolean objects as 'true' and 'false'.
CondEleWrapper A simple wrapper around a QGItem's condEleChild Element.
ConditionFormat Format that knows how to parse and print condition Elements (aka 'condEleChild' Elements) objects, as wrapped by CondEleWrapper.
CreateEdgeModeEvtHandler Recall behavior, from QGraphEditorJFrame: o To create an edge: Mouse-down on the first vertex, drag to the second vertex, and mouse-up on it.
CreateSubqModeEvtHandler Recall behavior, from QGraphEditorJFrame: o To create a subquery: Mouse-down on the background, drag to enclose the desired vertices, and mouse-up to create the subquery around the surrounded vertices.
CreateVertexModeEvtHandler Recall behavior, from QGraphEditorJFrame: o To create a vertex: Click on the background (creates vertex in query) or on a subquery (creates vertex in subquery).
LabelGroup Groups textual information for a QGItem or Subquery.
QGAddLinkFormat Format that knows how to parse and print QGAddLink objects.
QGCellEditor An editor that knows how to edit Annotation, condEleChild Element, and QGConstraint objects via the passed Format object.
QGConstraintFormat Format that knows how to parse and print QGConstraint objects.
QGEdFormat A superclass to QGraph format classes.
QGEdJTable JTable subclass that simply returns the correct editor based on the type of object in a cell.
QGItemTableModel The TableModel returned by QueryCanvas.getTableModel() to represent QGItem instances as a property sheet/editor.
QGObjTableModel Abstract superclass to TableModels that edit a Query, Subquery, or QGItem.
QGraphEditorJFrame The main QGraph Editor JFrame.
QueryCanvas A PCanvas that knows how to create, display, and edit QGraph queries.
QueryTableModel The TableModel returned by QueryCanvas.getTableModel() to represent Query instances as a property sheet/editor.
SelectModeEvtHandler Recall behavior, from above: o You can select either one AbsQueryChild, or nothing (no selection).
SubqueryTableModel The TableModel returned by QueryCanvas.getTableModel() to represent Subquery instances as a property sheet/editor.
